meanings.definition: A cover or lid for a container.
meanings.sent1: I placed the deckels on the jars to keep the food fresh.
meanings.sent2: Please make sure to close the deckels tightly on the containers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to play with the deckels, thinking they were toys.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed under the deckels of the cookie jar.
meanings.sent5: The colorful deckels on the gift boxes sparkled under the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To cover or seal with a deckel.
meanings.sent1: She deckels the envelopes before sending them out.
meanings.sent2: Remember to deckels the package securely with tape.
meanings.sent3: The chef deckels the pot, trapping the delicious aroma inside.
meanings.sent4: His words deckels her heart with warmth and comfort.
meanings.sent5: The magician deckels the box, preparing for his next trick.

meanings.definition: The uppermost part of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The captain stood proudly on the deckels of the ship.
meanings.sent2: The crew members gathered at the deckels to watch the sunset.
meanings.sent3: Seagulls perched on the deckels, enjoying the sea breeze.
meanings.sent4: The stormy waves crashed against the deckels of the ship.
meanings.sent5: The flag fluttered at the top of the deckels, signaling victory.
